en: The border is a trap. Begun in 2005, [Operation Streamline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Streamline) has criminalized border crossing. Authorized ports of entry, tiny holes shown here as 15-miles wide, [turn back asylum seekers](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/at-the-us-border-asylum-seekers-fleeing-violence-are-told-to-come-back-later/2018/06/12/79a12718-6e4d-11e8-afd5-778aca903bbe_story.html?utm_term=.1caf2e540b8c), pushing them into the [100-mile-wide border zone](https://www.aclu.org/other/constitution-100-mile-border-zone), where they are exposed to harsh conditions from both the environment and law enforcement.
es: La frontera es una trampa. Desde 2005, [Operation Streamline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Streamline) ha criminalizado el cruce fronterizo. Los puertos de entrada autorizados, mostrados aqu√≠ como peque√±os huecos de 15 millas, [rechazan los solicitantes de asilo](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/at-the-us-border-asylum-seekers-fleeing-violence-are-told-to-come-back-later/2018/06/12/79a12718-6e4d-11e8-afd5-778aca903bbe_story.html?utm_term=.1caf2e540b8c) y los empujan hacia [la zona fronteriza de 100 millas](https://www.aclu.org/other/constitution-100-mile-border-zone) donde condiciones duras del medio ambiente y de ICE los oprimen.
fr: La fronti√®re est un pi√®ge. Commenc√©e en 2005, [l‚ÄôOp√©ration Streamline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Streamline) a criminalis√© le passage des fronti√®res. Les points d‚Äôentr√©e autoris√©s, des trous minuscules montr√©s ici comme faisant 15 miles de diam√®tre, [rejettent les demandeurs d‚Äôasile](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/at-the-us-border-asylum-seekers-fleeing-violence-are-told-to-come-back-later/2018/06/12/79a12718-6e4d-11e8-afd5-778aca903bbe_story.html?utm_term=.1caf2e540b8c), les repoussant dans [la zone frontali√®re des 100 miles](https://www.aclu.org/other/constitution-100-mile-border-zone), o√π ils sont expos√©s √† des conditions tr√®s dures en raison √† la fois de l‚Äôenvironnement et de l‚Äôapplication de la loi.

en: Volume 2 of Torn Apart is a deep and radically new look at the territory and infrastructure of ICE‚Äôs financial regime in the USA. This data & visualization intervention peels back layers of culpability behind the humanitarian crisis of 2018.

en: Freezer examines the cold banalities of ICE through connections between products, contractors, and subsidiaries. Our categorization schema highlights the interplay of ideological and physical control behind ICE: Staples, Doctrine, Machines, The Threat of Violence, Reforming Bodies, Surveillance, The Flow of Bodies and Goods, Walls, and Mixed Bag. ‚ÄúMurderboard‚Äù depicts these as an ‚Äúevidence board,‚Äù where scraps of data are linked with string. Click on a sticky note to scroll through contracts. ‚ÄúICE Tray‚Äù presents this data as a tree map. Hover over the rectangles to see category, product, and contractor names; click on them to scroll through contract data; or click "play."

Nuestro esquema de categorizaci√≥n resalta el rejuego de control ideol√≥gico y f√≠sico de ICE: Grapas, Doctrina, Maquinas, Vigilancia, La Amenaza de violencia, El Flujo de cuerpos y bienes, Paredes y Mezcla. "Pizarr√≥n" muestra estas categor√≠as como "pizarra de evidencia," donde peque√±os retazos de informaci√≥n se atan con cuerda fina. Haga click en una de las peque√±as notas para ver los contratos. "La Bandeja" representa esta data como un mapa arbol. Acerque el mouse a los rectangulos para ver la categor√≠a, el producto, y el nombre de los contratistas; haga click para ver los contratos en detalle; o simplemente dele a "play."
fr:
"Le cong√©lo" examine la banalit√© froide de l'ICE √† travers les connexions entre les produits, les sous-traitants et les filiales. Notre sch√©ma de cat√©gorisation met en √©vidence la reprise du contr√¥le id√©ologique et physique d'ICE: banalit√©, doctrine, machines, surveillance, circulation des corps et des biens, menaces de violence, murs et pout-pourri. "Tableau"

"Bac √† ICE" repr√©sente ces donn√©es sous la forme d'une carte d'arbre. D√©placez la souris sur les rectangles pour voir la cat√©gorie, le produit et le nom des contractants; cliquez pour voir les contrats en d√©tail; ou cliquez simplement sur "jouer".
